S_su: High soluble sugars typical of brewery wastewater; adjusted to meet COD and VSS/TSS targets
S_aa: Moderate amino acids from protein in brewery waste
S_fa: Soluble long chain fatty acids from minor lipid content
S_ac: Acetate as dominant VFA in brewery wastewater
S_IC: Inorganic carbon set to match 60 meq/L alkalinity at pH 7.2
S_IN: Ammonia nitrogen set to meet TKN = 1500 mg/L after organic-N accounting
S_I: Soluble inert COD (food/beverage waste ~0.5–1% of COD)
S_cat: Other cations (Na+, Ca2+) to close electroneutrality with VFAs and bicarbonate
S_an: Other anions (Cl-, SO4--) set to zero; charge balanced via S_cat
S_co2: Dissolved CO2 consistent with elevated alkalinity
X_c: Composite particulate organics tuned to match VSS
X_I: Particulate inerts adjusted to achieve TSS/VSS targets
S_K: Free potassium (excludes K bound in polyphosphate)
S_Mg: Free magnesium (excludes Mg bound in polyphosphate)
X_PAO: Phosphorus accumulating organisms present at low inlet levels
X_PP: Polyphosphate storage; S_IP + X_PP ≈ TP = 0.2 kg P/m3
